item.title: Dust flies in Ayers Rock Resort $65m writedown
item.description: The Indigenous Land Corporation (ILC) is making sweeping changes after writing off more than $62 million from the value of its flagship tourism property at Uluru. The Federally-funded corporation paid $317 million for the Ayers Rock Resort in 2010 but its value has now been written down to about $250 million.

item.title: Review questions Ayers Rock Resort valuation and buy by Indigenous Land Corporation
item.description: An advisory group that delivered the highest valuation for central Australia's Ayers Rock Resort in 2010 was paid a fee based on the purchase price.

item.title: Ayers Rock Resort losing $3 million a month while it waits for tourists to return
item.description: Ayers Rock Resort says it is losing millions of dollars of month while it waits for tourism to pick back up from the pandemic slumber.

item.title: Update your ABC News homepage for more local stories
item.description: We've got an ABC News homepage for you. Adjust your settings for the right mix of local and national news.

item.title: Hundreds of jobs on horizon after green light from Transgrid for Hydrostor's compressed-air energy storage in Broken Hill
item.description: While the future of one of Broken Hill's major mines is still uncertain, a green energy storage project to be built in the coming years may provide employment opportunities for some of the displaced workers.

item.title: Carnarvon banana growers using freeze-dried facility to save fruit rejected by Australian supermarkets
item.description: Tonnes of West Australian bananas that would end up as waste or mulch are being made into freeze-dried snacks and used to make products like vodka as Carnarvon growers look to reduce wastage.

item.title: Banana industry turns to robots and AI for 'dangerous' packing-shed task of cutting fruit from stem
item.description: It takes effort to get bananas from the farm to the fruit bowl, with growers relying on a significant workforce to pick and pack. Now scientists are working on technology to make it easier and safer.

item.title: South Australian Liberals elect Vincent Tarzia as new leader to replace David Speirs
item.description: South Australia's Liberal Party has elected Vincent Tarzia as its new leader, replacing David Speirs, who announced his resignation last week.

item.title: Underground compressed air energy storage facility green-lit at Broken Hill
item.description: An old mine in Broken Hill will be re-purposed by Canadian company Hydrostor as an "innovative" renewable energy storage and generation project tipped to create hundreds of local construction jobs.

item.title: Betrayal of Trust: Australia's Childcare Crisis
item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election
item.description: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

item.title: Australia's growing cohort of tenants fear they will rent forever
item.description: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

item.title: Graduates in 'debt vortex' as HECS front and centre for first time in an election
item.description: New research shows a sharp rise in HECS debts, despite graduate earning power declining, as student loans become a potent election issue for the first time.

item.title: Next-generation voters call for better engagement ahead of federal election
item.description: Young people in Albury say issues that directly affect them and their communities are not being addressed by major parties for the 2025 election campaign.

item.title: Tiwi Islanders eager to have their say as remote voting for the federal election begins
item.description: Voters in the small remote community of Pirlangimpi on the Tiwi Islands, north of Darwin, have become some of the first to cast their votes for the federal election.

item.title: Record gold price sees West Australian mine revived
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Tennant Creek hopes gold mine reopening marks return to 'gold capital'
item.description: As the first gold bars are poured at the reopened Nobles Nob gold mine in the Northern Territory, locals hope it will bring a return to the region's golden era.

item.title: US demands Australia lifts defence spending by $40b a year 'as soon as possible'
item.description: The United States wants Australia to lift spending on defence to about $100 billion a year, with its Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth warning of a "real and potentially imminent" threat from China.

item.title: What the Socceroos need against Saudi Arabia to qualify for the World Cup
item.description: The Socceroos are just a solid performance from reaching their sixth FIFA World Cup finals in a row, but must remain focused against Saudi Arabia in Jeddah. Here's everything you need to know.

item.title: Mat Ryan wanted to freeze time on 100th appearance for Socceroos after penalty save
item.description: The keeper said he felt like he had played his final Socceroos match when he was left out of the starting XI late last year. Now he's celebrated his 100th international with a fine penalty stop as Australia progressed to the FIFA World Cup.

item.title: Heather Ewart reflects on the tough road to Back Roads success
item.description: Heather Ewart was a powerhouse political reporter when she was asked to create a show about regional Australia. A decade later, and with her final season going to air, Ewart admits that getting the idea off the ground was no easy feat.

item.title: Ausgold acquires 860ha of farmland for Katanning Gold Project
item.description: Ausgold's deal includes an 860-hectare land acquisition, as well as compensation and relocation of the farming families involved.

item.title: Traditional owners sign native title agreement for Agnew gold mine
item.description: Tjiwarl Aboriginal Corporation meets with South African miner Gold Fields in Leinster to sign an agreement for one of the WA's oldest gold mines.

item.title: Nestory Irankunda returns to Socceroos squad after 10-month absence as Tony Popovic praises maturity
item.description: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic praises Nestory Irankunda's maturity as he names the starlet in his squad for the first time this year ahead of the "Soccer Ashes" against New Zealand.

item.title: Robert Karl Huber sentenced over manslaughter of Lindy Lucena
item.description: Robert Karl Huber is sentenced to 12 years in prison over the death of his partner Lindy Lucena in Ballina in 2023.

item.title: Commonwealth Avenue Bridge upgrade likely to cause commuter chaos
item.description: Major upgrades addressing the structural safety of the Commonwealth Avenue Bridge will soon begin, leading to two years of significant traffic disruption.

item.title: Former A-League footballers Clayton Lewis and Kearyn Baccus sentenced over betting scam
item.description: Both players were paid $10,000 each to intentionally get themselves yellow cards while playing for Macarthur FC against Sydney FC to influence overseas bets on the game.

item.title: Southern pygmy perch 'ear bones' provide data to re-establish populations
item.description: Information gleaned from tiny growth rings on "ear bones" of native pygmy perch could be the key to bringing them back from local extinction in the lower Murray.

item.title: Betting companies keep millions stolen from investors by 'VIP' gambler
item.description: Nick and Aimee Mazza's hard-earned cash was gambled away by a man they thought was investing it. Bookmakers encouraged him to keep betting.

item.title: Losing Streak
item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: Gold price hits record high, topping $US4,000 an ounce for first time, amid US shutdown and lower interest rates
item.description: The price of gold has hit another record and is set to become Australia's second most valuable resource export after iron ore.

item.title: Calls for national gambling watchdog grow amid NT conflict allegations
item.description: The NT government is standing by its de-facto regulation of Australia’s $50 billion online gambling industry, despite allegations that it is too closely linked to the sector.

item.title: Las Vegas licence hearing turns nightmare for boss of Australian pokies giant
item.description: Regulators in the world's most influential gaming jurisdiction have dismissed a licence bid by the boss of Australia's Ainsworth Game Technology, branding him "arrogant", "misleading" and lacking in "emotional intelligence".

item.title: Albanese government's BetStop scheme not working, former gambler says
item.description: Diehard Richmond fan "Tiger Shaun" says he's watched on in horror as gambling advertising and sponsorships have come to dominate football — and become a constant reminder of the addiction he has struggled with.

item.title: More than $6 million of cocaine and methylamphetamine seized during vehicle stop in southern NSW
item.description: Highway patrol stopped the black luxury SUV on a major New South Wales highway for a random drug and alcohol test on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Survey finds majority of Victorian renters face problems — but not nearly as many lodge a complaint
item.description: A survey of 1,000 Victorian renters finds nearly four in five households faced a tenancy issue over a 12-month period — but only half of them escalated the issue by lodging a complaint.

item.title: NT politicians call for inquiry into Australia's de facto online gambling regulator
item.description: More than 40 of Australia's corporate bookmakers are based in the Northern Territory for its low taxes and what critics describe as weak regulation.

item.title: Mate Stipinovich, Aristides Avlontis, Karl Whitburn jailed for bungled Albany drug smuggling attempt
item.description: Three men forced to cling to an esky to survive in wild seas off Albany as they tried to import hundreds of kilograms of cocaine into Western Australia are described by a judge as "Keystone criminals" at their sentencing.

item.title: Australia is all in on AUKUS. In Donald Trump's America, it's more complicated
item.description: In Washington on Monday, Anthony Albanese made something clear once again: Australia is all-in on the trilateral defence pact. Clarifying what US powerbrokers think remains a multi-billion-dollar question.

item.title: What we know about 'mind-boggling' NBA rigging and poker fraud cases
item.description: The allegations involve NBA luminaries, multiple New York mafia families, millions in cash and even an x-ray poker table that could read cards face down.

item.title: Newcastle mother calls for tougher laws after toddler run down by e-bike
item.description: More than a year after her 21-month-old child was hit by an e-bike, a Newcastle mother is calling for change.

item.title: Walking netball adaptation helping players stay on the court
item.description: Before they take the court, the Magnolias strap on knee braces and tie bows in their hair. But don't be deceived, they're playing one of the 'most competitive games', and there may be elbows thrown.

item.title: NSW government's drug summit response rejects medicinal cannabis defence for drivers for now
item.description: The government says it was "investigating" a medical defence for drivers prescribed cannabis but ruled out the use of sniffer dogs and strip searches for suspected drug possession at music festivals in its response to last year's drug summit.

item.title: The key role a 'lost' reef is playing in South Australia's algal bloom fight
item.description: A marine ecologist's discovery two years ago sparked a restoration project and has become a key element in South Australia's response to a devastating algal bloom.

item.title: Dicky Beach holiday park residents angry after Sunshine Coast Council decision
item.description: More than 100 residents face an uncertain future after a Queensland council votes to end permanent residencies at a holiday park.

item.title: Caravan street parking solution stifled by council red tape, storage owners say
item.description: A Queensland council struggling to solve a caravan street parking crisis is hampered by its own planning laws, a storage business says.

item.title: Oyster farmers blockade trucks carrying oysters from algal bloom waters
item.description: Oyster farmers have formed a blockade at Haslam in South Australia to prevent oysters from an area affected by the algal bloom being put in the waters around Streaky Bay.

item.title: Brazil's deadliest ever police operation leaves at least 120 dead after Rio de Janeiro drug raid
item.description: Brazil's deadliest ever police operation has triggered protests against the use of excessive force and calls for Rio's governor to resign.

item.title: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic says restoring Australia's football DNA is key to creating World Cup history
item.description: The Socceroos have historically been seen as plucky underdogs at the FIFA World Cup. Now, Tony Popovic believes those same traits can see his side create history.

item.title: Donald Trump's campaign against Venezuelan drug boats is rooted in past failure and a hatred of Nicolas Maduro
item.description: Donald Trump is on a revenge tour during his second stint in the White House and now his gaze has shifted to an enemy who once "humiliated" him — Nicolas Maduro.

item.title: Donald Trump’s war on drugs targets Venezuela
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: The Canberra Liberals need to put their internal feud behind them. It's hard to see how they'll do that
item.description: After suspending two backbenchers from her party room this week, Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley has been silent. And it's hard to see how staying silent is helping Canberrans build trust in her party and her as the ACT's alternative chief minister.

item.title: Horse racing replays edited to remove falls and deaths as industry grapples with social licence
item.description: For years, the racing industry has been quietly removing falls and deaths from its replays. Now, industry insiders are speaking out.

item.title: A game for the ages: Nan and teen granddaughter line up together in country netball
item.description: A grandmother and granddaughter played for their regional Victorian netball team, turning a secret plan into a moment of country sport history.

item.title: Fishers and researchers are working together to create a 'transformational' data set
item.description: An international program in which researchers collaborate with the fishing industry is generating a dataset that will change global weather forecasting.

item.title: Plan to apply commercial council rates for short-stay rentals sparks debate
item.description: A council in South Australia wants to charge short-stay rentals such as Airbnbs at a higher rate, saying they act as businesses.

item.title: Calls for football clubs to divest from pokies with more than $110 million lost to machines
item.description: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year.

item.title: NSW Police, WA Police and AFP charge 18 people in Strike Force Bloomfield drug bust
item.description: Police charge 18 people in Perth and Sydney and seize 268 kilograms of illicit drugs following a multi-agency investigation into a national crime syndicate.

item.title: Sorry seems to be the hardest word for ACT Transport Minister Chris Steel after bungled MyWay+ rollout
item.description: Five days after being censured in the ACT's Legislative Assembly for the bungled rollout of the territory's MyWay+ network, Transport Minister Chris Steel has issued a statement to "apologise to anyone impacted by the transition to the new service".

item.title: Family of Australian man accused of cocaine smuggling speak ahead of possible Bali death sentence
item.description: The sister of Australian man Lamar Ahchee, who has been on trial on drug charges in Bali, describes the moment she heard the news of his arrest.

item.title: High-speed rail business case linking Sydney and Newcastle supported by government assessment body
item.description: The business case for high-speed rail between Sydney and Newcastle identifies four initial station locations for a one-hour journey.

item.title: Oscar Piastri says he still has what it takes to win F1 world championship
item.description: Oscar Piastri has said he is still a serious contender for the Formula 1 world championship despite seeing his lead evaporate over the past five races.

item.title: Chinese-made electric buses on Australian roads spark cybersecurity concerns after Norway flags issue
item.description: The same Chinese company that makes electric buses now under review in Denmark and Norway also has electric buses on Australian roads.

item.title: A letter to Anthony Albanese could allow Labor MPs to speak up on gambling reform
item.description: Andrew Wilkie has asked the PM to allow a free vote on banning gambling advertising and it appears many Labor MPs would support it.

item.title: Albury's Macquarie Textiles celebrated for decades of manufacturing
item.description: Textile manufacturing took Albury's work to the Opera House, federal parliament, the Olympics and beyond.

item.title: Renewable energy 'spilled' as generation outgrows demand
item.description: Mountains of clean power are regularly "wasted" as Australia's energy system evolves. But a large amount of battery storage is waiting in the wings, ready to soak it up.

item.title: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to return 'Yellow Peril' home
item.description: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to take the city's controversial "Yellow Peril" sculpture.

item.title: Spike in dolphin deaths at Huon Aquaculture pens prompts questions from Tasmanian regulator
item.description: Tasmanian regulators question major salmon farm operator Huon Aquaculture about the effectiveness of its "predator" nets after a spate of dolphin deaths.

item.title: Tasmanian renters wanting a pet just got new protections. Here's how to get approval
item.description: Under the updated legislation, landlords now need a "reasonable" rationale to say no to a tenant having pets — and that reasonableness can only be decided by an independent tribunal.

item.title: Northern NSW growers welcome bumper grain harvest as south plagued by drought
item.description: Growers at Walgett are grinning from ear to ear as they fill their silos with a bumper grain harvest.

item.title: Growing evidence of secret taxpayer-funded boats for illegal foreign fishers
item.description: An Australian Border Force vessel has docked in Broome carrying four fishing boats, prompting anger from the fishing industry over a government scheme that gives illegal fishers boats to return home in.

item.title: Cynthia Erivo praised for protecting co-star Ariana Grande from invader at Wicked event
item.description: Video shared across social media shows a man jumping over a crowd-control barrier, running towards Grande and putting his arms around the singer.

item.title: A Great Act of Love by Heather Rose delves into her family's convict history
item.description: In A Great Act of Love, the award-winning author interweaves a surprising chapter of Tasmanian history with the story of her ancestor who was transported to Van Diemen's Land in the 1800s.

item.title: The other-worldly ecstasy of the Socceroos' penalty shootout against Uruguay, 20 years on
item.description: Nostalgia can be an intoxicating force, especially when it comes to the 20-year anniversary of the Socceroos' remarkable win over Uruguay on penalties, which remains an Australian cultural touchpoint.

item.title: Esperance community fights for more change, a decade on from deadly bushfires
item.description: A decade on from bushfires that claimed four lives, this community says not enough has been done to ensure they are safe.

item.title: China's seafood import rules behind a partial closure of Tasmania's rock lobster fishery
item.description: The Tasmanian government closed two zones within the state's rock lobster fishery just hours after the commercial season opened. The closure is in response to concerns about an antibiotic being used by salmon companies and the rock lobster industry's reputation in overseas markets.

item.title: South African man who attended Neo-Nazi rally outside NSW parliament has visa cancelled
item.description: The federal government has revoked the visa of a man who attended the far-right National Socialist Network protest at NSW's parliament house.

item.title: Queensland racing industry review delayed as government withholds landmark report
item.description: The report was supposed to be released in mid-October until an industry event was abruptly cancelled.

item.title: Landowner concerned about site rehabilitation as Murray Zircon shuts operations
item.description: A mine in South Australia's Murray Mallee is ceasing operations and says it will rehabilitate the site back to its original condition. However, the site's owner says the land will never get back to what it was before mining.

item.title: Category two cyclone predicted off NT coast by Thursday
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology has issued its first forecast track map for a tropical low over the NT, showing the system is expected to strengthen into a category two cyclone by Thursday night.

item.title: Thousands of power poles wrapped in protective mesh ahead of 'what could be a dangerous bushfire summer'
item.description: A fire-resistant mesh is being used to protect thousands of wooden power poles from bushfires across the NSW Central Coast and Hunter regions.

item.title: 'Little prospect of rate relief' following wages data release — as it happened
item.description: ABS figures show that workers received an average base pay increase of 3.4 per cent over the year to September. Webjet shares soar after a takeover offer from rival Helloworld. Here's a look back on how the business day unfolded.

item.title: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic fumes at penalty decision in 3-0 friendly loss to Colombia in New York
item.description: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic laments a "disappointing" penalty decision as the Socceroos fall to a 3-0 loss to Colombia in New York.

item.title: Through dust and drought, these women are redefining resilience
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: FOI data shows Australian mining and manufacturing sectors take months to detect cyber breaches
item.description: Australia's mining and manufacturing sectors are taking up to two years to notice and report cyber breaches to authorities, prompting concerns about the data security of industries critical to the nation's economy.

item.title: Oscar Piastri tipped to fight back in F1 championship at Las Vegas Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri is backed to regain form in the final three races of the F1 championship, despite the Australian trailing teammate Lando Norris on the drivers' standings.

item.title: Why celebrity scandals can leave us feeling shattered
item.description: Whether it's controversy around a jeans ad, voting for a political party you disagree with, or criminal allegations, it can feel confronting to learn more about a person you admire.

item.title: Queensland aquaculture company and CEO fined $300k for illegal barramundi farm
item.description: The company was sentenced to pay the fine, with the chief executive also given a $60,000 penalty as well as payment of court costs for the environmental breach.

item.title: Future of Liberty Bell Bay smelter in limbo
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: A helicopter conducts its first night-time water-bombing operation.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Boys' netball movement gains pace on Sunshine Coast
item.description: From regional Queensland to state level, boys' netball is gaining momentum and reshaping the future of the sport.

item.title: Zoe Terakes reclaims queer love in ancient Greek myths in debut short story collection
item.description: Zoe Terakes, star of Wentworth and Ironheart, has added another string to her bow, publishing a collection of short stories inspired by ancient tales — with a queer twist.

item.title: Martu rangers capture rare night parrot in WA's Pilbara region.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: F1 Las Vegas Grand Prix: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris disqualified, Max Verstappen wins
item.description: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris have both been disqualified from the Las Vegas Grand Prix, in a stunning post-race moment that has blown the battle for the Formula 1 drivers' championship wide open.

item.title: Calls to end water extraction from Great Artesian Basin before culturally significant springs are lost
item.description: Environmentalists are calling for mining giant BHP to end its water extraction from the Great Artesian Basin when a major desalination plant is built in South Australia's north.

item.title: What did McLaren do wrong to get Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris disqualified from the Las Vegas F1 Grand Prix?
item.description: McLaren apologises to Norris and Piastri as F1 officials explain why the drivers were disqualified in Las Vegas.

item.title: ElecraNet to explore alternative options for Northern Transmission Project after farmers voice concerns
item.description: ElectraNet are shifting their focus east, after farmers voiced concerns about renewable energy line Northern Transmission Project running through prime cropping country.

item.title: Federal government backtracks on reducing default speed limits
item.description: The truck industry has welcomed a federal government decision to walk away from lowering speeds on unsigned roads, but road safety experts question the move.

item.title: APY Lands community members disappointed after delay into hearing on governance
item.description: Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara (APY) Lands community members have been left disappointed by a last-minute decision to halt a hearing that was set to probe governance issues in the region.

item.title: Traditional owners travel to Darwin as fight over aquifer reaches NT Supreme Court
item.description: Dozens of Aboriginal Territorians from remote communities travelled to Darwin where they stand alongside Environment Centre NT in a bid to axe a controversial water allocation plan.

item.title: Invasive Species Council blames government for booming rabbit numbers
item.description: Landholders across Australia say rabbit numbers in some areas are at levels never seen before.

item.title: US National Parks to raise fees for millions of international tourists to popular sites
item.description: Changes set to take effect on January 1 will include annual park passes jumping to $US250 for foreign tourists, while US residents will continue to be charged $US80, according to authorities.

item.title: London Broncos rugby league hopes buoyed by Brisbane icon Darren Lockyer and players from PNG
item.description: The London Broncos might be the only rugby league club in Britain to have experienced relegation before a season even began — and Darren Lockyer, through the help of PNG Players, is hoping to bring them back.

item.title: Department of Transport and Main Roads orders shutdown of North Ipswich Free Shop
item.description: Queensland's transport department has threatened to penalise residents who set up street-side charity cupboards without filling in the requisite paperwork.

item.title: Varroa mite detected in bee hives at Sellicks Hill and Taratap
item.description: Beekeepers are being urged to monitor their hives more frequently after further detections of the deadly bee parasite varroa mite in South Australia.

item.title: Victoria faces risky summer with bushfire potential fuelled by spring grass growth
item.description: Dry conditions dogging Victoria put the state at a high risk of bushfires this summer, according to the latest summer fire outlook.

item.title: Oscar Piastri dismisses helping McLaren teammate Lando Norris win F1 drivers' championship
item.description: Oscar Piastri says McLaren raised the prospect of the Australian helping his teammate Lando Norris win the Formula 1 world championship, but it was rejected.

item.title: US futures markets halted as CME data centre overheats — as it happened
item.description: Derivates trading operator CME Group says trading in its markets has been halted due to a cooling issue at data centres. Global financial markets watch futures closely.

item.title: Jane Edmanson hangs up her Gardening Australia hat, reflects on labour of love behind show's success
item.description: As Gardening Australia's longest-serving presenter, Jane Edmanson says farewell and shares the secrets behind the success of Australia’s favourite gardening program.

item.title: Kyra Cooney-Cross scores stunning long range goal as Matildas down New Zealand 5-0
item.description: A spectacular long range effort from Kyra Cooney-Cross has helped the Matildas to a dominant 5-0 win over New Zealand in Australia's penultimate game before hosting the Asian Cup in March.

item.title: Wala Kooral-bi juvenile justice facility opens in northern WA
item.description: An on-country youth diversion facility has been built in the state's far north, offering a culturally grounded alternative to traditional youth justice programs.

item.title: Albanese knows the power dynamic between Labor and mining interests has shifted
item.description: There has been a shift in the power dynamic between Labor and the mining industry. This week's environmental law reform is its embodiment.

item.title: Think you're ready to own a home? Here are the costs that experts want you to consider
item.description: We asked three financial experts about the up-front and ongoing costs of buying a home and for their tips on how to prepare for home ownership.

item.title: Cricket Australia set to speak with Usman Khawaja after he labelled Perth Ashes Test pitch a 'piece of shit'
item.description: Usman Khawaja may face a sanction for labelling the first Ashes Test surface a "piece of shit", with Cricket Australia understood to be disappointed by the remarks.

item.title: After suffering 'terrifying' postpartum rage, this mother wants others to know they're not alone
item.description: When Ali Gossage gave birth a second time, she did not experience the constant joys of motherhood. Instead, she was sometimes filled with "terrifying" anger.

item.title: The spooky First Nations movie you need to see at BIFF
item.description: First Nations stories are combined with modern horror scares in this new film from Australian creatives Chris Broadbent and Enzo Tedeschi.

item.title: Oscar Piastri wins Qatar F1 sprint race, qualifies fastest for GP, edging closer to Lando Norris in standings
item.description: Australian driver Oscar Piastri is doing everything he can to catch McLaren teammate Lando Norris in the world championship race, winning the sprint race and qualifying in pole position for the Qatar Grand Prix.

item.title: Labor should theoretically be confident ahead of the 2026 Victorian election — but challenges are mounting
item.description: On paper, Labor should be confident that it will score an unprecedented fourth term in office when Victorian voters go to the ballot box in a year's time, with the Liberal opposition still scrambling to present as an electable alternative.

item.title: Indonesia flood death toll climbs amid cyclone devastation
item.description: Torrential rain causes flash floods and landslides in Indonesia, where the toll rises as authorities mount rescue operations.

item.title: LNP's Wayde Chiesa promises to get to work after victory in Hinchinbrook by-election
item.description: The LNP's Wayde Chiesa will be the next representative for the Queensland seat of Hinchinbrook, which had been safely held by Katter's Australian Party since 2017.

item.title: Photographer Lyn Alcock captures wild antics of Dryandra's numbat population over 20 years
item.description: Lyn Alcock is known as the 'Numbat whisperer', spending hours every day observing and photographing the tiny, endangered marsupials, recording behaviours that have never been seen before.

item.title: Hinchinbrook by-election a tick of approval for LNP government but no crystal ball for outcome of next election
item.description: A week is a long time in politics, let alone three years, and the LNP's success at the next election is by no means assured, writes Jack McKay.

item.title: Australia's Travis Head prepared to play any role in day-night Ashes Test against England
item.description: Travis Head says he has no qualms if he is shifted back down Australia's batting order following his exploits as an opener in the first Ashes Test.

item.title: F1 standings: Lando Norris, Max Verstappen, Oscar Piastri set for Abu Dhabi decider after Qatar GP
item.description: Oscar Piastri's hopes of winning the F1 title suffered a hammer blow after McLaren's strategy error in Qatar, but there is still hope. Here's how the Aussie can upset the odds in Abu Dhabi's decider.

item.title: Christmas Island's last dog embraced by the remote community
item.description: Dogs were banned some years ago to protect the unique wildlife of Christmas Island, but one very special chocolate Labrador remains, and she is shared by the whole community.

item.title: Geraldton bushfire destroys one home as up to 200 firefighters worked to control blaze
item.description: Authorities have downgraded their warning levels for bushfires burning in the greater Geraldton area to an 'advice' level after a challenging day for firefighters.

item.title: Pablo Escobar's final mistake and the lonely death of the cocaine king
item.description: More than three decades since his death in a rooftop shootout with police, the legacy of cocaine king Pablo Escobar continues to affect Colombia.

item.title: Tasmanians express mix of views ahead of final Macquarie Point stadium vote
item.description: By the end of this week, Tasmania will know whether or not Hobart will have a new AFL stadium. Many Tasmanians are still making up their own minds about whether they support it or not.

item.title: Maps reveal the Ukraine regions Vladimir Putin does not hold, but wants anyway
item.description: Donald Trump is expected to send his special envoy Steven Witkoff to Moscow this week to talk about a revised proposal for peace in Ukraine. There are five regions central to negotiations and Vladimir Putin wants them all.

item.title: Two men first in SA to be found guilty of charges arising from encrypted devices
item.description: Two South Australian men are the first in the state to be found guilty after standing trial for charges arising from the major police operation.

item.title: As teacher shortages loom across Australia these Queensland schools are trialling solutions
item.description: As staff shortages "near crisis point", these Queensland schools are going to extraordinary lengths to put teachers in classrooms — and keep them there.

item.title: South Australian farmers fear future as bird flu recovery causes egg oversupply
item.description: The industry was plagued by bird flu 12 months ago, but some producers are now struggling to sell their product due to a faster-than-expected recovery.

item.title: ASX edges higher, Bitcoin dives, government releases its National AI Plan - as it happened
item.description: The ASX edged higher, while the federal government released its National AI Plan. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Red Bull admits fault over 'clearly incorrect' suggestion Kimi Antonelli allowed Lando Norris to overtake him
item.description: Red Bull retracts suggestions made by its engineer that Mercedes driver Kimi Antonelli deliberately let Lando Norris overtake him at the Qatar Grand Prix.

item.title: South Coast fishermen charged over alleged deliberate scuttling of trawler
item.description: Two Ulladulla fishermen have been charged under federal sea-dumping laws over the alleged deliberate sinking of an unseaworthy trawler.

item.title: Folk Rhythm and Life Festival cancelled at last minute due to permit problems
item.description: A festival that has been running for 30 years has been cancelled just days before it was due to begin.

item.title: Elderly woman allegedly assaulted in 'unprovoked and isolated' incident at South Plympton
item.description: Police say members of the public helped the 84-year-old woman after the alleged attack before she was taken to hospital with serious injuries.

item.title: Spear fisher accused of killing protected blue groper on NSW Central Coast
item.description: Investigations are underway into the death of the near-threatened species on the NSW Central Coast, prompting calls for better awareness about local marine life.

item.title: Fugitive prisoner who evaded police for months charged after dramatic Alice Springs arrest
item.description: An absconded prisoner has been charged with 15 offences, including strangulation and making threats to kill, after escaping police custody and evading capture for more than 70 days.

item.title: Queensland man Brett Daniel Taylor charged with assisted suicides of three people granted bail
item.description: A Queensland man charged with assisting the suicides of three people has successfully applied for bail.

item.title: England trio Ben Stokes, Mark Wood and Jamie Smith spotted riding e-scooters without helmets in Brisbane
item.description: England captain Ben Stokes and several teammates have been spotted in Brisbane riding e-scooters without helmets ahead of the second Ashes Test.

item.title: Usman Khawaja ruled out of Brisbane Test following back injury, Travis Head set to open
item.description: Australia will be without veteran opener Usman Khawaja for the second Ashes Test after the 38-year old was ruled out due to an ongoing back problem.

item.title: Review into incident at Tasmania's Ashley Youth Detention Centre of makeshift spit hood on detainee's head tabled in parliament
item.description: An incident at a Tasmanian youth detention centre where a detainee had an improvised spit hood put over his head while being transported by a contracted security company, has been criticised for being "entirely incompatible" with human rights.

item.title: Six prisoners remain in NT watch houses after report exposes 'inhumane' conditions
item.description: Days after acting Northern Territory Ombudsman Bronwyn Haack raised the alarm about "inhumane" conditions in overcrowded police cells, the government says just six inmates remain.

item.title: Lemon8 and Yope put on notice as social media age ban targets
item.description: Social media platforms Lemon8 and Yope are put on notice about age limit laws as both apps surge in popularity ahead of a ban for under 16s.

item.title: Indian government demands Sanchar Saathi app be pre-installed on Apple, Android and Xiaomi mobile phones
item.description: New Delhi wants a government app installed on all of the country's mobile phones, but opposition MPs and privacy advocates have voiced concerns about surveillance.

item.title: Environment Protection Authority to monitor Ballarat Gold Mine amid air pollution concerns
item.description: Ballarat Gold Mine has exceeded national standards for potentially dangerous air pollutants.

item.title: Australia's longest-running radio show celebrates 80 years of rural storytelling
item.description: Australia's longest-running radio show is celebrating 80 years on air, and while so much has changed in farming and broadcasting, the core of The Country Hour remains the same.

item.title: Three Paralympians talk about how disability altered their lives in documentary Changing Track
item.description: Filmmaking siblings Tristan and Timothy Kenyon's documentary Changing Track explores how competing in the Paralympics changes lives.

item.title: England cricketing great Robin Smith dies in Perth aged 62
item.description: The cricket world mourns after the death of English batting great Robin Smith in his Perth home.

item.title: Pete Hegseth defends second US strike on alleged Venezuelan drug boat
item.description: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth defends authorising a follow-up strike on a Venezuelan boat that killed 11 people.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Sabrina Carpenter slams White House for using her music in ICE video
item.description: Two-time Grammy winner Sabrina Carpenter slams the White House for using her song in a social media post about ICE raids, telling the Trump administration to never involve her in its "inhumane agenda".

item.title: Victorian government relaxes car parking rules around well-connected residential developments
item.description: The Victorian government vows to overhaul "outdated" car parking requirements for new residential developments in areas that are well-serviced by public transport.

item.title: Stadium minister Eric Abetz holds press conference with CFMEU
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Hopes remain for return of eagles to relocated nest at Bundaberg Hospital site
item.description: A wedge-tailed eagle's nest was moved in an operation costing about $100,000 involving a 60-tonne crane, a specialist arborist and a carefully engineered basket.

item.title: Peter Scammell charged with murder, extradited over 2020 death of nurse Katrina Hawker in Palmerston
item.description: A 44-year-old man has been charged with murder over the death of his partner near Darwin, and has been extradited from Victoria ahead of his first appearance in the Darwin Local Court.

item.title: Demersal fishing ban announced for commercial, recreational fishers in Perth and WA amid scarce fish stocks
item.description: Strict bans limiting commercial and recreational fishing in Perth and WA are announced in an effort to save some under-threat fish species from the brink of collapse.

item.title: Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson surprise patrons with impromptu performance at Aussie pub in NYC
item.description: Hugh Jackman sung the crowd-pleaser Sweet Caroline and even climbed onto the top of the bar counter for the performance.

item.title: What time does the Gabba Test start? How to watch the Ashes, and Brisbane weather forecast
item.description: The second Ashes Test is upon us and we have fingers crossed it will last more than two days. Here's everything you need to know.

item.title: What happened to Lisa Lynn? The untold story of Greg Lynn's first marriage and his wife's sudden death
item.description: Long before Greg Lynn was convicted of murder in Victoria's High Country, his estranged wife died suddenly at home in Mount Macedon. Now, some of those closest to Lisa Lynn are pushing for the coroner to re-examine her death.

item.title: Government considers offloading retiring Tiger helicopters to Ukraine
item.description: As the United States attempts to broker a peace deal at the Kremlin in Moscow, it is expected a significant funding boost from Canberra to aid Ukraine's war efforts is imminent.

item.title: How to prepare yourself and your child for the social media ban on December 10
item.description: From December 10, young people will lose access to part of their online world. Here's how to support them.

item.title: Tasmania's local and state governments to pay $650,000 for Foo Fighters concert in Launceston
item.description: Tasmania's "biggest concert ever" will take place at Launceston's York Park next month when American rock band Foo Fighters play their only Australian show.

item.title: Man killed, two others injured in northern NSW shooting
item.description: A man has died and two others injured following a shooting on a property in Murwillumbah in northern NSW.

item.title: First community-designed, culture-led home from new outback housing initiative arrives in Tennant Creek
item.description: A one-of-a-kind home, designed with the input of Tennant Creek families, has rolled up the Stuart Highway from Adelaide on a convoy of trucks. It is part of a new initiative aiming to transform housing in remote First Nations communities.

item.title: Jodie Hill denies involvement in alleged murder of 72-year-old Dimboola man John Hunter
item.description: A woman on trial for the alleged murder of 72-year-old Victorian man John Hunter tells the Supreme Court she was present when he was attacked but another person was responsible for his death.

item.title: New police investigation into Lisa Lynn’s death stalls over bill for expert report, family says
item.description: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police will not pay for an expert report.

item.title: One player's case against the world's biggest crypto casino
item.description: Chat logs and gambling data show the tactics used by Australian-run online casino Stake to keep one user hooked.

item.title: Tens of thousands of cars damaged after hailstorms lash Queensland and parts of New South Wales
item.description: Insurers are urging those with damaged cars to make their claims as soon as possible in the aftermath of hailstorms across Queensland and parts of New South Wales.

item.title: Steve Smith says adaptability is Australia's focus heading into the second Ashes Test at the Gabba
item.description: Steve Smith reveals the mindset Australia is taking into the second Test as the Aussies look to go up 2–0 in the Ashes.

item.title: Risk of 'imminent' RBA rate hike rising, as Australian dollar moves above 66 US cents — as it happened
item.description: A leading economist says the "risk" of an "imminent" RBA interest rate hike is "rising", while former treasurer Peter Costello is urging Australia to arrest its fertility downturn.

item.title: Increasing wait times for mammograms could have 'potentially tragic' consequences
item.description: A Medicare funding freeze and high cost of training new students has left a shortage of workers and blown out wait times of critical diagnostic services.

item.title: Former NT administrator, musician and author Ted Egan dies aged 93
item.description: Folk music legend, author and former Northern Territory administrator Ted Egan has died aged 93.

item.title: Descendent emotional to see WWI digger in unmarked grave receive recognition
item.description: South Australian high school students have helped to uncover the legacies of five war veterans who were laid to rest in unmarked graves.

item.title: Anti-bullying review recommends making kids 'upstanders'. Does it work?
item.description: Research suggests that actively encouraging students to be 'upstanders' to bullying may even be counterproductive.

item.title: SA CFS volunteer sentenced for intentionally starting bushfire near Naracoorte
item.description: An 18-year-old who had been a cadet captain in the Country Fire Service admits deliberately lighting a bushfire near Naracoorte, but mental health conditions lower the sentence he might otherwise have been given.

item.title: Cost of living remains a sore point for voters as political year wraps
item.description: A mammoth year in politics ended with a focus on what is worrying most Australians ahead of Christmas: the cost of living.

item.title: Woman dies after dog attack in South Australia's upper Spencer Gulf
item.description: South Australian police say a woman has died after a dog attack at Whyalla in South Australia's upper Spencer Gulf region this afternoon.

item.title: Israel to compete at Eurovision Song Contest in 2026, prompting several nations to withdraw
item.description: Public broadcasters in Spain, Ireland and the Netherlands say they will not participate in next year's event and more are expected to follow.

item.title: AUKUS will survive Trump, says Australia's top diplomat in London Stephen Smith
item.description: The trilateral agreement has come under significant scrutiny, but Australia's top diplomat in London says he believes its future is assured.

item.title: Community housing provider HousingFirst defends dual rent rises on newly acquired properties
item.description: Elderly residents in Melbourne's south-east say they are in financial distress after two rent increases, which a community housing organisation says are a necessary move to a standard rent-setting model.

item.title: The best new TV shows of 2025, from The Golden Bachelor to The Studio
item.description: From a send-up of Hollywood studios to a chilling depiction of violence and masculinity to an age-appropriate reality TV romance, these are our favourite TV shows of 2025.

item.title: Education leaders call on News Corp to cease 'harmful' NAPLAN league tables
item.description: Forty-one signatories to an open letter say they are "dismayed" and that school rankings cause "harm to our communities".

item.title: A blend of Cool Runnings, Eddie the Eagle: The Filipino curling team on the cusp of an Olympic spot
item.description: The idea of the Philippines curling team reaching the Winter Olympics has a hint of Cool Runnings about it, while one team member, Alan Frei, has more than a suggestion of Eddie the Eagle. But at the heart of this story is a genuine sporting fairytale that is one step away from becoming an Olympic legend.

item.title: The cold supermoon will appear in the night sky tonight. Here's how to spot it
item.description: The final supermoon of the year is set to delight stargazers tonight. Here's how to spot it.

item.title: Federal politics live: Australia to manufacture multiple-rocket guided missiles at new factory
item.description: Australia will begin manufacturing multiple-rocket guided missiles this month with the opening of a new factory in South Australia. Follow live.

item.title: South Australian golf course wetland is breeding site for locally extinct tiny native olive perchlet
item.description: Golf courses around the world feature picturesque water ponds as a challenging hazard for players to avoid, but scientists are diving right in. They say golf club wetlands are an ecological safe haven to repopulate threatened native fish.

item.title: Markets live updates: ChatGPT's owner OpenAI launches in Australia, partners with NextDC, ASX slips
item.description: The company that brought AI into household vernacular is launching in Australia today. It comes as other companies like Meta are struggling to make traction in this space. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Compressed air energy storage is coming to Broken Hill, but how does it work?
item.description: Broken Hill will be the location of Australia's first large-scale compressed air energy storage system. What is it and how does it work?

item.title: Pentagon's AUKUS review finds areas to put nuclear submarine pact on 'strongest possible footing'
item.description: The review has "identified opportunities to put AUKUS on the strongest possible footing", the Pentagon says. But a congressman who has seen the report says it "fully endorses" the pact.

item.title: F1 title contender Oscar Piastri non-committal about helping Lando Norris win in Abu Dhabi
item.description: Oscar Piastri dodges the question of whether he might help Lando Norris lift the world F1 title in Abu Dhabi, saying McLaren has not discussed the issue.

item.title: Police officer's claim about search for Lindy Lucena in Ballina tested at watchdog hearing
item.description: A Law Enforcement Conduct Commission is examining why it took police officers nearly an hour to respond to a Triple Zero (000) call about an assault which left Lindy Lucena dead at the hands of her partner.

item.title: Housing crisis taking a toll on caravan park owners in WA's South West
item.description: The housing crisis is landing at the doorstep of caravan parks and owners like Greg Homer, who says the transition from tourism operator to landlord is taking a toll.

item.title: Zak Crawley says Nathan Lyon being dropped for second Ashes Test helped him find rhythm
item.description: Nathan Lyon speaks during an awkward TV interview as Zak Crawley says the spinner's omission helped the English batter find his rhythm.

item.title: Ed Craven's VIP gamblers club
item.description: Leaked messages between an Australian multi-billionaire and his former associate reveal the inner workings of the online casino Stake.

item.title: Australian red-tipped bananas go viral as social media interest ramps up
item.description: Red-tipped bananas are not new to Australian consumers, but they have gone viral on social media this month after an inquisitive post from two bewildered British backpackers.

item.title: Socceroo Aziz Behich excited that World Cup draw could set up rematch with Argentina
item.description: The Socceroos cannot wait to learn who their opponents will be at the upcoming World Cup, especially if it allows them to handle some unfinished business.

item.title: US military says it killed four men in strike on suspected drug vessel
item.description: The US military says it has killed four men in a strike on a suspected drug vessel in international waters in the Eastern Pacific

item.title: Live: Fires, heatwaves strike across Australia with extreme warnings issued
item.description: A broad heatwave is expected to spread across Australia, with short and sharp bursts of heat throughout the southern states. Follow live.
